Dragon Age: The Veilguard has realms where people used to worship divine beings. They've left behind traces of the past, which still hold power to this day. Some, such as the elven statues that dot regions, even improve your chances of survival. Here's our guide on where to find all Evanuris Altars in Dragon Age: The Veilguard.

All Evanuris Altars in Dragon Age: The Veilguard

The Dragon Age: The Veilguard Evanuris Altars have humanoid or elf-like features. When you stumble upon these structures, be sure to interact with them. Doing so causes four glistening disks to appear. Destroying them with your ranged attacks grants a permanent +100 health boost. If you're having trouble locating them, take a look at the wispy trails of light to see their general direction.

Note: Aside from Evanuris Altars, there are also large wolf-like statues that grant a free skill point. You can learn more about these in our Fen'harel Altars guide.

Arlathan Forest #1

Found at the Riverside Ruins while you're doing the Spirits of the Dalish companion quest for Bellara.

Arlathan Forest #2

Similar to the above, you'll find this statue while doing Bellara's Spirits of the Dalish quest. Once you reach the Shadowy Grove, you'll see this structure in a small wooded nook.

Arlathan Forest #3

From the Ancient Aqueduct beacon, head outside and you'll see a ledge next to a tower. This Dragon Age: The Veilguard Evanuris Statue is right beside the tower itself.

Arlathan Forest #4

Follow the trail that leads further northeast until you arrive at an area called the Tainted Woods. The statue is in the middle of the ruins of a small fort.

That does it for our guide on where to find Evanuris Altars in Dragon Age: The Veilguard. We'll continue updating this article in the coming days, so stay tuned.

The lands of Thedas are under threat from formidable foes, including some menacing elven gods, and it's up to Rook and their allies to save the day. For more tips and tactics, you can visit our Dragon Age: The Veilguard guides hub.
